column1: Before coronavirus we had a strong economy that benefited Wisconsin workers and families. We can get back there by: ✔️ investing in workforce development ✔️ keeping taxes low ✔️ cutting red tape https://t.co/8HfT0RziCl

“Our congressional district should be proud to have a congressman like Bryan. Bryan showed great concern when COVID-19 was beginning calling his committee for our input to see how he could assist us. He’s a man of integrity." Thank you Ed!  Proud to have support from our farmers! https://t.co/cbStVsJMJL
Coronavirus continues to impact our health our economy and our way of life. We must stay resilient. I am working in Congress to keep you and your families healthy and safe. https://t.co/KzopD8IWGX

Throughout the coronavirus crisis we’ve seen health care professionals workers and local companies step up to the plate and help us defeat the virus. Jockey in Kenosha was a leading PPE producer during the pandemic. Read more: https://t.co/s9pKkymlef

Coronavirus has affected our health our economy and our way of life. I was proud to support the CARES Act to provide relief to our community. These funds help keep the most vulnerable safe and healthy. I am committed to defeating the virus. https://t.co/W8kgpbSTmX

When our frontline workers needed personal protective equipment during COVID-19 I got to work connecting Kenosha’s Jockey & Milton’s Charter NEX to produce thousands of medical gowns for health care workers like Bridget.   Watch my new ad “PPE” below: https://t.co/op4E6q8TJs

Our health care professionals have been heroes during the COVID-19 crisis. It’s why I supported legislation that: 🩺 provides $16 billion for medical supplies & equipment 🏥 funds public health agencies to prepare prevent & respond to COVID-19 👩‍⚕️expands telehealth opportunities https://t.co/onCcgWndt9

Before COVID-19 we were building a strong economy that benefited workers: 📈 wage growth ✅ 7 million jobs created  👷‍♂️ 50-year low unemployment rate  I’m working to get WI back to work & rebuild our economy. ✅ keep taxes low ✅ invest in communities ✅ support skills education
Nurses are on the frontline lines of the Coronavirus saving lives. They’re risking their own health to take care of those in need. Thank you all for your amazing work! #NationalNursesDay

When we knew there was a PPE shortage for health care professionals combatting the coronavirus we began to act.  I worked to help @Jockey expedite their production of personal protection equipment. https://t.co/LjMXzSGXdM

STATEWIDE: Jump Around will be playing on radio stations across Wisconsin at 3PM. Wisconsinites are encouraged to get outside and jump around at 3! Wear your badger gear and maintain social distance! Find a station playing it near you here: https://t.co/qQZd0Nydlv

The Kennedy Center should not be receiving $25 million in taxpayer funding while simultaneously laying off hundreds of workers.   My bill takes the money back. That money should be focused on coronavirus relief efforts. https://t.co/uGFZWCIfvK
@ScottWalker The $25 million in funding should go to fighting coronavirus!

$25 million for the Kennedy Center shouldn’t have been included in the coronavirus relief package.  Funding a D.C. theater has nothing to do with combatting the coronavirus.  My bill would take back the $25 million. Thanks @SteveScalise for your support.  https://t.co/3n3qtDqRPr

During World War II Jockey made parachutes for our troops overseas.   Now they’re producing gowns and donating scrubs for our health care professionals on the frontlines battling coronavirus. Thank you @Jockey! https://t.co/FSGthpcCXG
THANK YOU to our doctors who are on the frontlines of fighting coronavirus. Join me in thanking our doctors today.   #NationalDoctorsDay https://t.co/PrZL2RBnKD

The relief package we passed ensures health care professionals have the funding they need to combat the Coronavirus while also protecting American workers’ paychecks.  The legislation is far from perfect but swift action was necessary to provide support for American families.
I encourage you to tune in to the President’s address at 8:00 pm CT on the coronavirus. https://t.co/cK38j3AUqZ
